title: Cat. 11  Porringer, 1705/25
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">John Dixwell (American, 1680–1725)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver; 2.5 × 10.2 × 17.8 cm (1 3/6 × 4 3/4 × 7 1/6 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the General and the Jessie Spalding Landon Funds, 1978.60

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On body left of handle and on under­side of handle (fig. 11.1)

Engraved on the bottom: B. / R\*S. (fig. 11.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Gebelein Silversmiths, Boston, before 1978.

With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 1978.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1978.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, A Decade of Decorative Arts: The Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, November 12, 1986–January 4, 1987, p. 79, cat. 52 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Naeve et al. (1986), p. 79, cat. 52 (ill.).

Kane et al. (1998), p. 380.

</section><section id="figures">Porringer, 1705/25.

fig. 11.1 fig. 11.2 </section>
